intro: Grevillea chrysophaea var. canescens, commonly known as the silver-leafed grevillea, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It features narrow, linear leaves that are covered in a fine silvery or grayish pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, red-orange flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often used in landscaping and conservation efforts.
